description: Expand sin x / exp x = x-x^2+x^3/3-x^5/30+... and invert nonzero coefficients.
formula: a(n) = [n mod 4 > 0] * (-1)^(n+1+[n/4]) * n!/2^[n/2]. - _Ralf Stephan_, Mar 06 2004E.g.f.: sin(x)/exp(x)  =x-x^2/(G(0)+x); G(k)=2k+1-x+x*(2k+1)/(4k+3-x+x^2*(4k+3)/( (2k+2)*(4k+5)-x^2+x*(2k+2)*(4k+5)/G(k+1))); (continued fraction). - Sergei N. Gladkovskii, Nov 20 2011
crossrefs: Absolute values are essentially the same as A046979, where zeros are replaced by ones.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
